page.title: 11SCHOOLS IN CLACTON
page.content: Clacton County High school was built in 1928.It was the towns first secondary school and it only had 80 pupils.Now in{1985}it has more than fifteen hundred.Since then the County education authority has built Colbaynes secondary school,London Road school,Alton Park Junior school and Burrsville Junior school.Holland Park school has got 10 class rooms,a dining room and two halls.It was built in 1903, and in 1985 there are just over 300 pupils on roll. The newest school in Clacton is called Ravenscroft, although by the time you read this, the new school at London Road ( now named Coppins Green ) will have been built and opened.
